content.rendered:
School children in Chandigarh celebrate Christmas Day amid much fun and joy at a school in Chandigarh. The children were surprised by the arrival of Santa Claus who spread the cheer of Christmas. The children also cut a Christmas cake and enjoyed the day. The children from Smile Foundation interacted with the privileged children of the school. Such activities are organized to reduce the divide between the underprivileged and privileged children by organizing such group activities and focuses on sensitizing the privileged children to reach out to their counter parts who might not get the best of facilities. The children had much fun together and the event was a success.

Under Child for Child programme, Smile Foundation visits various schools and conducts engaging sessions for the young minds. It sensitizes children towards various causes and let them realize their privileged status.

CFC currently reaches out to nearly one million privileged children in 900 schools spread across 417 districts of India, every year. In addition, their parents and teachers are also involved in the process. The programme has today reached out to each part of India with the exception of Lakshadweep.
